me.timothy.bots.database.mysql

Class MysqlObjectMapping<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.timothy.bots.database.mysql.MysqlObjectMapping<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - What this mapping maps
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectMapping<A>, SchemaValidator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MysqlAdminUpdateMapping, MysqlBannedUserMapping, MysqlCreationInfoMapping, MysqlFullnameMapping, MysqlLCCMapping, MysqlLoanMapping, MysqlObjectWithIDMapping, MysqlRecentPostMapping, MysqlRecheckMapping, MysqlRepaymentMapping, MysqlResetPasswordRequestMapping, MysqlResponseHistoryMapping, MysqlResponseMapping, MysqlShareCodeMapping, MysqlUserMapping, MysqlUsernameMapping, MysqlWarningMapping

    public abstract class MysqlObjectMapping<A>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectMapping<A>, SchemaValidator
    Describes an ObjectMapping and SchemaValidator combination based on mysql

        connection - the mysql connection
        table - the table this mapping maps to in the datbase

      • fetchListFromSet

        protected java.util.List<A> fetchListFromSet(java.sql.ResultSet set)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Fetches every a in the set. Starts with set.next(), so skips the current row if the set has already been accessed.
        Parameters:
        set - the set to fetch from
        Returns:
        the list of as in the set
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if one occurs

      • validateSchema

        public void validateSchema()
        Description copied from interface: SchemaValidator

        Validates the schema to ensure it exists (or create it if possible). If the schema does exist, then verifies it matches what's expected. This should be sufficient enough to prevent versioning errors without being unnecessarily restrictive.

        Things that should be verified:

        • That the fields/columns exist and are of the right type
        • That fields that must have certain behavior (e.g. default to null, autoincrement) in order for the mapper to function correctly do.

        Things that should not be verified:

        • Foreign keys - These shouldn't be depended on, and removing these is reasonable performance tweak in some instances
        • Maximum field sizes - Except where the size requirement is nonintuitive, maximum field sizes can often be tweaked for performance/usability reasons
        Specified by:
        validateSchema in interface SchemaValidator

      • purgeSchema

        public void purgeSchema()
        Description copied from interface: SchemaValidator
        Purges the schema; deleting everything in the schema and the schema itself.
        Specified by:
        purgeSchema in interface SchemaValidator

      • verifyColumns

        protected void verifyColumns(java.sql.DatabaseMetaData metadata)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Verifies the columns in the table using the metadata of the database.
        Parameters:
        metadata - the metadata
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if one occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the columns aren't whats expected

      • verifyColumn

        protected MysqlColumn verifyColumn(java.util.List<MysqlColumn> toFind,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> errors,
                                   java.sql.ResultSet columns)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Verifies a column returned from DatabaseMetaData is expected. If the column is unexpected or there are differences between it and the expected value, errors should be appended with a string describing the issue.
        Parameters:
        toFind - list wrapped version of columns
        errors - the current errors
        columns - the result set. you should check the current row of the result set
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if one occurs
